title: Ticket #6847: Design a load-balanced HTTP file service for CHTC
description:
We want to design and implement a load-balanced HTTP file server which we'll deploy somewhere in the CHTC cluster. This will help solve several problems:

  • Jobs with large file transfers can place a heavy load on the submit servers. We want to shift this burden onto dedicated infrastructure whose only job is to serve files.
  • Some CHTC users are using offsite file services which are very slow to download/upload data from.
  • Some external users have been asking for something similar, we want to gain experience in this area so we can better advise them.

This ticket is largely a placeholder for a design document that will explain the architectural details for such a system. We'll look at many questions including the following:

  • What does the hardware architecture look like? How many physical machines do we need to host the various components? What hardware will we need to purchase?
  • What does the software architecture look like? Will the load-balanced HTTP nodes be hosted in VMs or containers?
  • What does the file system look like? Assuming we use a shared file system, is it better to go with HDFS, CEPH or something different?
  • Where on the UW campus network is the best place for this to live?
  • How much file system redundancy do we want?
  • How many load balanced nodes do we want?

Design document and ticket updates to follow.
